events.title: Halifax Explosion
events.description: A massive munitions explosion occurred in the harbor of Halifax, Nova Scotia, when the SS Mont-Blanc, a French cargo ship laden with wartime explosives, collided with the Norwegian vessel SS Imo. The explosion devastated the city, killing approximately 2,000 people and injuring thousands more.
events.significance: It was one of the largest non-nuclear explosions in history and had a lasting impact on disaster response and urban reconstruction.

events.title: Treaty of Riga Signed
events.description: The Treaty of Riga was signed, ending the Polish-Soviet War and establishing the borders between Poland and Soviet Russia (later the USSR).
events.significance: This treaty shaped the geopolitical landscape of Eastern Europe in the interwar period.

events.title: Alabama Joins the Confederate States
events.description: Alabama officially joined the Confederate States of America during the American Civil War.
events.significance: This represented a significant moment in the secession movement leading to the Civil War.

events.title: Washington Monument Completed
events.description: The Washington Monument in Washington, D.C., was officially completed and opened to the public after nearly 40 years of construction.
events.significance: It became an iconic symbol of the United States and its first president, George Washington.

events.title: The Babri Masjid Demolished
events.description: A large group of Hindu activists demolished the Babri Masjid mosque in Ayodhya, India, sparking widespread religious riots and political upheaval.
events.significance: The event intensified Hindu-Muslim tensions in India and had significant political ramifications.
